The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
Proposition 39, which governs the District’s general obligation bonds, requires the establishment of a citizens’ oversight committee.  Following the passage of Measure G-2004 on November 2, 2004, the Board of Trustees took action on May 10, 2005 to establish a Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee.  Measure G-2010 was passed by the voters on November 2, 2010, after which the Board of Trustees took action on December 14, 2010 to amend and restate the bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
	 
The Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee (CBOC) is required by statute to meet at least annually to review the District’s Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 bond projects plan and to ensure that bond funds are being appropriately used as authorized by the voters.  There are no penalties defined in law for failure to convene a citizens’ oversight committee; however, the spirit of the law contemplates that districts will make every reasonable effort to ensure that the committee functions at least once each year to fulfill its statutory duties.  The current CBOC convenes quarterly for meetings.
	 
Pursuant to Proposition 39, the Measure G-2004/Measure G-2010 Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee members shall serve a term of two (2) years, commencing as of the date of appointment by the Board.  No member may serve more than two (2) consecutive terms.
	 
The Board is asked to approve the appointment of the current members of the Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee as listed below for a second two year term.

items.item_details:
APPROVE AS ACTION ITEMS 
Contracts
	 
Preconstruction Agreement – BLACH CONSTRUCTION COMPANY – Lease/Leaseback Contractor, EVC South Campus Development
	 
At the Board meetings held March 13, 2012 and June 12, 2012, the Board was presented information and details by the Program Management team and District legal counsel on the Lease/Leaseback project delivery method.  Subsequently, on July 10, 2012 the Board approved this method for two Measure G-2010 projects – San Jose City College Theater & Vocational Technology project and the EVC South Campus Development project. At that same meeting the Board approved a design agreement with HMC Architects to provide design services for the EVC South Campus Development project using the lease/leaseback delivery method.  
	 
In keeping with that process, a Request for Qualifications (RFQ) for Lease/Leaseback Construction Services for the EVC South Campus, including preconstruction services was issued on November 9, 2012. Ten Statements of Qualifications (SOQ’s) were received.  A Selection Committee comprised of District staff, College staff and faculty scored the SOQ’s, pre-qualified five firms and then conducted interviews.  These five contractors then submitted sealed proposals for lump sum preconstruction services fee and fee percentages for construction services.
	 
Based on the combination of points awarded and fee proposal, BLACH CONSTRUCTION COMPANY of Santa Clara was determined to be the successful firm.  Their proposal includes a fixed fee for preconstruction services [including design support, subcontract bidding and Guaranteed Maximum Price (GMP) development] of $138,770 and construction service fee percentages to be applied to the Guaranteed Maximum Price.  The GMP and Site & Facilities Lease will be brought to the Board for approval and execution per conventional Lease/Leaseback contracting.  In addition to the Preconstruction Fee, a Reimbursable Allowance was negotiated per the terms of the RFP in the amount of $10,000.  
	 
The Board is asked to approve an Agreement with BLACH CONSTRUCTION COMPANY for preconstruction services in the amount of $148,770 and construction service fee percentages to be applied to the Guaranteed Maximum Price for the South Campus Development project at EVC.
	 
	 
Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) – GHD – EVC-01 – Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing and Fire Protection Design Services 
	 
As part of scheduled maintenance an assessment was performed on the Evergreen Valley College’s mechanical, electrical, plumbing (MEP) and fire protection systems.  The assessment identified over 120 items that need to be addressed over the next six years.  These were ranked in order of priority and estimated costs applied.  Using the work identified as Phase 1 priority, qualification proposals were sought from firms approved by the Board on August 14, 2012 to provide MEP engineering services related to Measure G-2010 projects.  Four responses were received, and based on District evaluation of those qualifications, GHD was selected to provide this service.  
	 
The Board is asked to approve PAA EVC-01 to GHD in the amount of $108,000 for design and construction support services for the Phase 1 Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing and Fire Protection Upgrade Project at EVC.
	 
	 
Construction Contract – WATERPROOFING ASSOCIATES, INC. – San Jose City College Jaguar Gymnasium Roof Replacement Project 
	 
Bids for the Roof Replacement Project were opened on January 24, 2012 and based on the evaluation of the bids, WATERPROOFING ASSOCIATES, INC. was determined to be the lowest responsive bidder.  A review of WATERPROOFING ASSOCIATES, INC's bid documents found that certain forms related to the Construction Careers Agreement (CCA) were not included in their bid submitted at bid time as required by the instructions to bidders, however this was rectified by WATERPROOFING ASSOCIATES, INC. before noon the day following the bid. The District, with the support of legal council, determined that this was a minor irregularity and issued a Notice of Intent to Award the contract to WATERPROOFING ASSOCIATES, INC.
	 
On January 28, 2013 the second bidder, Alcal Specialty Contracting, submitted a letter of protest based on the low bidder’s failure to include the required CCA forms.  The District reaffirmed its determination with legal council that this was a minor irregularity that could be waived and formally responded to Alcal January 30, 2013. The District's response letter is attached for reference.
	 
The Board is asked to award a contract to Waterproofing Associates, Inc. in the amount of $966,218 for the San Jose City College Jaguar Gymnasium Roof Replacement Project thereby validating the District's determination of the minor irregularity and denial of the bid protest submitted by Alcal Specialty Contracting, Inc.

The California Community College Trustees (CCCT) board serves a major role within the Community College League of California. Meeting five times a year, the twenty-one member board provides leadership and direction to ensure a strong voice for locally elected governing board members.
	 
From January 1 through February 15, nominations for membership on the CCCT board will be accepted in the League office. Nominations are to be made by member district board of trustees, and each district may nominate only members of its board. Each nominee must be a local community college district trustee, other than the student trustee, and must have consented to be nominated. Only one trustee per district may serve on the board.
	 
This information was made available to SJECCD Trustees in January 2013, and one Trustee informed President Cruz of his interest. It is recommended, therefore, that the Board of Trustees nominate Trustee Jeffrey Lease to serve as a member of the CCCT board.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees nominate Trustee Jeffrey Lease to serve on the California Community College Trustees (CCCT) Board.

items.item_details:
The Board has scheduled a Board Development Study Session.  The goal of this session is to build a sense of team and the importance of speaking with "one voice." The session will build a clear understanding of the role of individual board members and the role and authority of the board as a whole, using this understanding as a frame of reference to review critical components of effective trusteeship, evaluate current practices and identify areas in need of change. Some of the specific topics for review and discussion will include:
	 
Board Vision/Mission/Goals
Effective Governance Processes: The Carver Governance Model
Current Board Structure: Committees and Task Forces
Board Self Evaluation and Workplan Development
Board Skills Development Program
Board Master Calendar

The SJECCD Board of Trustees has requested a budget study session to facilitate "informed" and "data-based" decision making to guide the Chancellor and staff by providing a budget policy framework for development of the FY 2013/2014 budget, leading to adoption of a tentative District budget in June and final budget on September 10, 2013.  In particular, the Budget Study Session will focus on the following:
	 
Budget Principles, Guidelines and Priorities
2013/2014 Budget Workshop
Current Status
Governor's Budget
Principles
Assumptions
Budget Management/Balancing Strategies
Timelines
	 
It is expected that this session will be interactive with ongoing discussion, questions and answers throughout the session.

Information will include a review of the Second Quarter Budget Report for the period ending December 31, 2012.  The State budget, current District financial position, and estimates for FY 2012/2013, FY 2013/2014, FY 2014/2015, and FY 2015/2016 are presented.
	 
The FY 2012/2013 Second Quarter Budget Report was provided to the Board of Trustees under separate cover.  An electronic copy is attached.
